# Introduction

This file documents how I setup odin programming language.

## Instructions
Install the common compiler tools.

```{bash}
sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git gcc clang llvm lld
# Has to be the same as gcc version
clang++ -v | grep "Selected GCC"
# TODO: Update gcc if so.
sudo apt install libstdc++-12-dev

# Check the versions
gcc --version
clang-14 --version
llvm-config --version

# Clone the repository
git clone --depth=1 --branch=dev-2024-06 https://github.com/odin-lang/Odin
cd Odin || echo "Odin directory not available"

# Parallel build
# Explicit compiler selection
LLVM_CONFIG=$(which llvm-config-14) make release-native \
    -j"$(nproc)" \
    CC=clang-14 CXX=clang++-14

cat <<EOF >> ~/.bashrc
# Odin (version-controlled PATH)
export ODIN_ROOT="$HOME/Odin"
export PATH="$ODIN_ROOT:$PATH"
EOF
```

Updating gcc and then recompiling
```{bash}
# Update gcc
sudo apt install -y gcc-12 g++-12
sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/gcc gcc /usr/bin/gcc-12 100
sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/g++ g++ /usr/bin/g++-12 100
sudo update-alternatives --config gcc  # Select gcc-12
sudo update-alternatives --config g++  # Select g++-12
gcc --version  # Should show 12.x.x
g++ --version  # Should show 12.x.x
# Recompile Odin
# Restart clean just in case
rm -rf ~/Odin
git clone https://github.com/odin-lang/Odin
cd ~/Odin/

# Change to the stable release
# Choose previous month
git checkout dev-2025-04
# or stay on master/main, you have to decide
git checkout master
git pull

# Explicitly set toolchain if you want
LLVM_CONFIG=llvm-config-14 CC=gcc-12 CXX=g++-12
make release-native

# Test compiler
./odin version

# Run atomic tests (now should work)
./odin test tests/core/sync -collection:tests=.
```

Run the classic hello world script as detailed in the odin guide.
Create the odin file and then run.
```{odin}
package main
import "core:fmt"
main :: proc() {
  fmt.println("Hellope!")
}
```

```{bash}
odin run .
odin run hellope.odin -file
```

Go through the rest of the guide ([see Odin Guide Reference 2](#odin-overview)).
